Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian early patterned or Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with turn to bowl; white slip; exterior glazed streaky black; reserved edge of foot; some white slip on underside; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The width and the height of the foot sherd are consistent with the Wild Goat and patterned styles. Both styles are contemporary. For parallels, see Lemos no. 77 from Cerveteri and nos. 236-7 (the Würzburg chalices).
Alphabetically a date before 575 would be difficult.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 756, pl. XXI, no. 756)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 407)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0299) (phase 2)
